chapter.title: Getting Started
chapter.para: In this chapter the installation of Solarium is covered and a quick-start with some simple queries. If you want to get a feel for Solarium you can skip the installation part and go right to the select and update query pages. If you intend to read the rest of the manual you might skip the example queries, they will be covered in-depth in their own chapters.

sect1.title: Installation
sect1.important: For installing Solarium you need at least PHP version 5.2

sect2.title: Getting Solarium
sect2.para: There are two ways to get Solarium. You can download a prepacked release from GitHub, or use git. In this case a prepacked download is assumed.

Go to the Solarium GitHub project page (https://github.com/basdenooijer/solarium) and click 'Downloads'. Select a version and download the file. Unpack the file, the Solarium library can be found in the 'library' folder.

sect2.title: Making Solarium available in your application
sect2.para: Solarium doesn't use any require or include statements. See this page for the reasons why.
This means you need to make sure yourself the classes are available. This can be done using an autoloader, see https://gist.github.com/836745 for an example.
